definition: to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
bow string/string of musical instrument/watchspring/chord (segment of curve)/hypotenuse/CL:根[gen1]
round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)

sentences.english: The ship's orchestra's conductor stood to one side, looking peeved but apprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 艦隊的管弦樂團指揮站在一邊，面色雖慍怒但很知趣。

sentences.english: A work in which a solo instruments is contrasted and blended with the orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 獨奏樂器與管弦樂團互相對比和合作的作品。

sentences.english: I had in mind something along the lines of the Liveville Philharmonic Orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 我心裏想的是“活用村愛樂管弦樂團”之類的。

sentences.english: The awards ceremony kicked off with an orchestra performance.
sentences.chinese: 管弦樂團的表演爲這個頒獎典禮揭開序幕。

sentences.english: He plays in the brass of the orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 他在管弦樂團裏演奏銅管樂器。

sentences.english: Yeah. I'm in my sorority. And I'm also in the orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 有，我參加了女大學生聯誼會，還參加了管弦樂團。

sentences.english: Would you be interested in joining the TOCS Orchestra?
sentences.chinese: 有興趣參加千橡中文學校管弦樂團嗎？

sentences.english: Her biggest dream is to stand on the podium and conduct an orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 她最大的夢想是站在指揮台上指揮一個管弦樂團。

definition: part (in multi-part instrumental or choral music), such as the soprano part or bass part
